revised_title: Recovery Theory: Explaining the Decay of Luminosity in Radioactive Compounds
tldr: This article investigates the decay of luminosity in radioactive compounds, specifically radium luminous compounds. The author proposes a recovery theory, suggesting that destroyed active centers can recover at a rate proportional to their concentration in the material. This theory helps explain the observed behavior of luminosity curves and provides a basis for predicting the ultimate behavior of compounds with varying compositions.
